user_utterance: Thanks for the latest tip. I know my BED makes irregular eating and cravings tough, but I’d like to try a tiny, practical step: a 60‑second pre‑meal pause, a quick hunger check (1–5), and a glass of water before I eat. If I’m still hungry or craving after the pause, I’ll wait 10 minutes before deciding what to do. Could we start with that and maybe set a gentle reminder for tomorrow? If I feel triggered, we can switch to a short grounding breath instead.

agent_utterance: Love this plan. Here’s your ultra-simple start: 1) Do a 60-second pre-meal pause. 2) Do a quick hunger check on a 1–5 scale. 3) Drink a full glass of water. 4) If you’re still hungry or craving after the pause, wait 10 minutes before deciding what to do next. 5) If you feel triggered, switch to a short grounding breath (inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4) during the pause. For tomorrow, I can help with a gentle reminder. Tell me a preferred reminder time, or I can suggest a default like 12:30 PM (before lunch) and/or 6:30 PM (before dinner). To set a reminder yourself: on iPhone, use the Reminders app; on Android, use Google Calendar or Tasks. Here’s a sample reminder text you can paste: “Pre-meal pause + water: 60s, hunger check (1–5), water, if still hungry after pause, wait 10 minutes.”
